channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Sharath Jois, Heir to Founder of Ashtanga Yoga, Dies at 53
item.description: He became one of the world’s most sought-after teachers of a style of yoga that his grandfather helped turn into a popular form of exercise worldwide.

item.title: Gen Z is obsessed with the punishing ‘Winter Arc challenge,’ but an expert says it’s the wrong way to reach goals
item.description: There's a healthier way to build sustainable health habits.

item.title: After its entire board resigned overnight, 23andMe will cut over 200 employees and its cancer research in an urgent bid to nurse the company back to health
item.description: The DNA-testing firm said in a Tuesday SEC filing, “there is substantial doubt about the company’s ability to continue.”

item.title: Federal Judge Blocks Louisiana Law Requiring Ten Commandments in Classrooms
item.description: The ruling is likely the first in what could be a long legal fight for conservative Christian groups hoping to amplify public expressions of faith.

item.title: Martha Stewart, the original influencer, says she hates the ‘trad wife’ trend that’s pervaded social media
item.description: "I hate it so much,” the 83-year-old Stewart said.

item.title: Israel Intensifies Strikes in Lebanon Amid Push for Cease-Fire
item.description: The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has deepened in recent days despite diplomatic efforts to move toward a temporary truce.

item.title: Israel Intensifies Strikes in Lebanon Amid Push for Cease-Fire
item.description: The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has deepened in recent days despite diplomatic efforts to move toward a temporary truce.

item.title: A Former Harrods Employee Accuses Al-Fayed of Trafficking and Says His Brother Knew
item.description: In a U.S. court filing, a former employee says she was trafficked, raped and abused when Mohamed al-Fayed owned Harrods, and that his brother Ali may ...

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah Trade Deadly Attacks
item.description: Israeli strikes pounded areas in the southern suburbs of Beirut, a day after eight people were killed, according to the authorities, in the northernmo...

item.title: Archbishop of Canterbury Resigns Over U.K. Church Abuse Scandal
item.description: Justin Welby, the leader of 85 million Anglicans worldwide, announced his resignation days after a report found he had taken insufficient action over ...

item.title: Here’s what the CEO of NASDAQ is learning from her son in his mid-20s
item.description: "He was learning market structure—he didn’t even realize he was learning it."

item.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s FDA Wish List: Raw Milk, Stem Cells, Heavy Metals
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr., one of President-elect Donald J. Trump’s advisers on health, is taking aim at the agency’s oversight on many fronts.

item.title: He Thought He Knew Horses. Then He Learned to Really Listen.
item.description: Warwick Schiller made his name as an expert trainer. An enigmatic little horse completely changed his outlook.

item.title: AT&T’s CEO says AI may cause power shortages and it could be ‘the next big social issue in the United States’
item.description: Gartner has echoed that by 2027, AI demand will exceed power utilities’ capacity
